translations.defaultText: An error has occurred during the Steam Assessment process. Please contact a Spirax representative if the problem persists.
translations.translationText: An error has occurred during the Steam Assessment process. Please contact a Spirax representative if the problem persists.

translations.defaultText: Boiler Average TDS should be larger than Makeup Water TDS, the TDS of the water in the Feedtank, and the TDS of the Condensate Return
translations.translationText: Boiler Average TDS should be larger than Makeup Water TDS, the TDS of the water in the Feedtank, and the TDS of the Condensate Return

translations.defaultText: Boiler efficiencies greater than 90% or less than 65% is highly unusual. Please check your fuel and steam generation inputs if boiler efficiency has been calculated. Alternatively re-enter a more realistic value.
translations.translationText: Boiler efficiencies greater than 90% or less than 65% is highly unusual. Please check your fuel and steam generation inputs if boiler efficiency has been calculated. Alternatively re-enter a more realistic value.

translations.defaultText: Boiler Efficiency has been calculated (overriding the default value):
translations.translationText: Boiler Efficiency has been calculated (overriding the default value):

translations.defaultText: Calculated feedtank temperature is less than the benchmark feedtank temperature. The caculations do not take into account failed steam traps that may be leaking steam into the condensate system.
translations.translationText: Calculated feedtank temperature is less than the benchmark feedtank temperature. The caculations do not take into account failed steam traps that may be leaking steam into the condensate system.

translations.defaultText: Calculations have returned an error, please recheck input parameteres -- Error Code
translations.translationText: Calculations have returned an error, please recheck input parameteres -- Error Code

translations.defaultText: Condensate temperature is lower than make-up water temperature
translations.translationText: Condensate temperature is lower than make-up water temperature

translations.defaultText: DSI Upstream Pressure should be less than Boiler Pressure
translations.translationText: DSI Upstream Pressure should be less than Boiler Pressure

translations.defaultText: Error - Boiler Efficiency must be greater than 0%
translations.translationText: Error - Boiler Efficiency must be greater than 0%

translations.defaultText: Error - Equivalent fuel energy of the condensate return is zero. Please check input parameters.
translations.translationText: Error - Equivalent fuel energy of the condensate return is zero. Please check input parameters.

translations.defaultText: Export failed. Please contact your local IT support team.
translations.translationText: Export failed. Please contact your local IT support team.

translations.defaultText: Export requires job changes to be saved. Save and Export?
translations.translationText: Export requires job changes to be saved. Save and Export?

translations.defaultText: Feedtank temperature is lower than make-up water temperature
translations.translationText: Feedtank temperature is lower than make-up water temperature

translations.defaultText: Flowrate of boiler feedwater must be greater than steam generation rate
translations.translationText: Flowrate of boiler feedwater must be greater than steam generation rate

translations.defaultText: Generating Assessment Proposals - This may take a while to complete
translations.translationText: Generating Assessment Proposals - This may take a while to complete

translations.defaultText: Generating Assessment - This may take a while to complete
translations.translationText: Generating Assessment - This may take a while to complete

translations.defaultText: Generating Final Assessment of Proposed Results - This may take a while to complete
translations.translationText: Generating Final Assessment of Proposed Results - This may take a while to complete

translations.defaultText: If Feedtank TDS entered is less than 40ppm (62.4 ¬µS/cm) the programme will use a minimum feedtank TDS default value of 40 ppm to calculate boiler blowdown, due to the addition of water treatment chemicals.
translations.translationText: If Feedtank TDS entered is less than 40ppm (62.4 ¬µS/cm) the programme will use a minimum feedtank TDS default value of 40 ppm to calculate boiler blowdown, due to the addition of water treatment chemicals.

translations.defaultText: Please check input values for "Average Feedwater TDS" and the "Average Boiler TDS" as the percentage of TDS Blowdown has been calculated to be
translations.translationText: Please check input values for "Average Feedwater TDS" and the "Average Boiler TDS" as the percentage of TDS Blowdown has been calculated to be

translations.defaultText: Please choose at least one of the following : Is fuel consumption measured, Is steam flow measured or Is Feedwater water measured and enter the appropriate associated values.
translations.translationText: Please choose at least one of the following : Is fuel consumption measured, Is steam flow measured or Is Feedwater water measured and enter the appropriate associated values.

translations.defaultText: Please Select one or more Proposals, features that are not already included in your current conditions Benchmark.
translations.translationText: Please Select one or more Proposals, features that are not already included in your current conditions Benchmark.

translations.defaultText: RO water treatment selected, returns on investment for auto TDS control and Heat Recovery will be significantly reduced due to the low TDS values in makeup water, reducing blowdown required.
translations.translationText: RO water treatment selected, returns on investment for auto TDS control and Heat Recovery will be significantly reduced due to the low TDS values in makeup water, reducing blowdown required.

translations.defaultText: Steam is not superheated at this temperature and pressure, therefore the entered temperature has been raised to 1 Kelvin above the saturation temperature at the specified pressure
translations.translationText: Steam is not superheated at this temperature and pressure, therefore the entered temperature has been raised to 1 Kelvin above the saturation temperature at the specified pressure

translations.defaultText: The boiler average TDS exceeds the maximum allowable TDS. This will lead to increased carryover increasing the risk of fouling, contamination, blocking steam traps, etc resulting in increased maintenance costs.
translations.translationText: The boiler average TDS exceeds the maximum allowable TDS. This will lead to increased carryover increasing the risk of fouling, contamination, blocking steam traps, etc resulting in increased maintenance costs.

translations.defaultText: The calculated cost of Carbon Emissions per year is zero, please enter the Key Parameter for unit cost or levy for Carbon Emissions.
translations.translationText: The calculated cost of Carbon Emissions per year is zero, please enter the Key Parameter for unit cost or levy for Carbon Emissions.

translations.defaultText: The calculated cost of Effluent per year is zero, please enter the Key Parameter for unit cost of Effluent.
translations.translationText: The calculated cost of Effluent per year is zero, please enter the Key Parameter for unit cost of Effluent.

translations.defaultText: The calculated DSI steam load is zero, please check the Feedwater and Condensate parameters for temperature and DSI steam pressure.
translations.translationText: The calculated DSI steam load is zero, please check the Feedwater and Condensate parameters for temperature and DSI steam pressure.

translations.defaultText: The calculated TDS Blowdown appears to be excessive, please check the boiler and feedwater TDS inputs.
translations.translationText: The calculated TDS Blowdown appears to be excessive, please check the boiler and feedwater TDS inputs.

translations.defaultText: The condensate returned percentage has calculated to more than 100%. This is not possible and suggests the values entered for TDS or temperatures in the water treatment and Feedwater and cendensate screens.
translations.translationText: The condensate returned percentage has calculated to more than 100%. This is not possible and suggests the values entered for TDS or temperatures in the water treatment and Feedwater and cendensate screens.

translations.defaultText: The hotwell temperature and pressure specified result in the water in the feedtank being steam. The entered temperature has been reduced to the saturation temperature at the specified feedtank pressure
translations.translationText: The hotwell temperature and pressure specified result in the water in the feedtank being steam. The entered temperature has been reduced to the saturation temperature at the specified feedtank pressure

translations.defaultText: The information set out above is illustrative only. Whilst every care is taken to ensure that the data is accurate and complete, Spirax Sarco Limited is not responsible for any errors and no reliance can be placed on the information unless a definitive contract to that effect is signed by us.
translations.translationText: The information set out above is illustrative only. Whilst every care is taken to ensure that the data is accurate and complete, Spirax Sarco Limited is not responsible for any errors and no reliance can be placed on the information unless a definitive contract to that effect is signed by us.

translations.defaultText: The makeup water TDS or condensate TDS were not entered at the benchmark stage. Feed tank TDS savings could not be calculated as a result. For a more accurate saving please enter these values.
translations.translationText: The makeup water TDS or condensate TDS were not entered at the benchmark stage. Feed tank TDS savings could not be calculated as a result. For a more accurate saving please enter these values.

translations.defaultText: The O2 scavenging chemicals cost field on the general tab/screen is empty. This value is required to calculate any DSI savings.
translations.translationText: The O2 scavenging chemicals cost field on the general tab/screen is empty. This value is required to calculate any DSI savings.

translations.defaultText: The TDS of the feedwater in the feedtank is above both the TDS values for condensate returned and  make-up water.  This suggests that either chemical dosing in the feedtank is taking place, or, an incorrect value has been used. Please tick the ‚Äúare chemicals added to the feedtank‚Äù check box, or check and input correct TDS values.
translations.translationText: The TDS of the feedwater in the feedtank is above both the TDS values for condensate returned and  make-up water.  This suggests that either chemical dosing in the feedtank is taking place, or, an incorrect value has been used. Please tick the ‚Äúare chemicals added to the feedtank‚Äù check box, or check and input correct TDS values.

translations.defaultText: The TDS value for condensate returned is greater the TDS value for make-up water. This is unusual for the water treatment specified, unless condensate contamination has taken place.
translations.translationText: The TDS value for condensate returned is greater the TDS value for make-up water. This is unusual for the water treatment specified, unless condensate contamination has taken place.

translations.defaultText: The TDS value for make-up water is greater the TDS value for condensate returned. This is unusual for the water treatment specified.
translations.translationText: The TDS value for make-up water is greater the TDS value for condensate returned. This is unusual for the water treatment specified.

translations.defaultText: The temperature entered results in the media selected being solid. The temperature has been raised to 1 degree kelvin above the freezing point of the selected media.
translations.translationText: The temperature entered results in the media selected being solid. The temperature has been raised to 1 degree kelvin above the freezing point of the selected media.

translations.defaultText: The value is above the maximum allowed.
translations.translationText: The value is above the maximum allowed.

translations.defaultText: The value is below the minimum allowed.
translations.translationText: The value is below the minimum allowed.

translations.defaultText: The value must be greater than the minimum value:
translations.translationText: The value must be greater than the minimum value:

translations.defaultText: The value must be less then the maximum value:
translations.translationText: The value must be less then the maximum value:

translations.defaultText: The volume of Condensate Return has been calculated negative, please check the Boiler House Water Consumption and Boiler Steam Generated input values. Condensate Return has been calculated as
translations.translationText: The volume of Condensate Return has been calculated negative, please check the Boiler House Water Consumption and Boiler Steam Generated input values. Condensate Return has been calculated as

translations.defaultText: This will reset your Steam Assessment back to the default values, are you sure you want to continue?
translations.translationText: This will reset your Steam Assessment back to the default values, are you sure you want to continue?

translations.defaultText: This will reset your Steam Efficiency Assessment data back to the default values. Would you like to reset the Proposal Assesment pages or reset all Benchmark and Proposal data?
translations.translationText: This will reset your Steam Efficiency Assessment data back to the default values. Would you like to reset the Proposal Assesment pages or reset all Benchmark and Proposal data?

translations.defaultText: You need to enter ALL of the TDS values from OR estimate your CONDENSATE RETURN: Makeup Water, Feedwater and Condensate
translations.translationText: You need to enter ALL of the TDS values from OR estimate your CONDENSATE RETURN: Makeup Water, Feedwater and Condensate

translations.defaultText: Additional savings in plant effluent, where this condensate has not been sent to drain.
translations.translationText: Additional savings in plant effluent, where this condensate has not been sent to drain.

translations.defaultText: All water entering the boiler house as part of the steam generation process.
translations.translationText: All water entering the boiler house as part of the steam generation process.

translations.defaultText: Allows you to input fuel type and costs.
translations.translationText: Allows you to input fuel type and costs.

translations.defaultText: Based on cost of fuel, carbon taxes, boiler house water & chemicals, and effluent produced in the boiler house.
translations.translationText: Based on cost of fuel, carbon taxes, boiler house water & chemicals, and effluent produced in the boiler house.

translations.defaultText: Before potential savings can be calculated, additional information is required:
translations.translationText: Before potential savings can be calculated, additional information is required:

translations.defaultText: Boiler efficiency can be increased to show the effect that this can have on fuel consumption.
translations.translationText: Boiler efficiency can be increased to show the effect that this can have on fuel consumption.

translations.defaultText: Boiler efficiency can be overwritten if known. The programme will use this new value in all calculations.
translations.translationText: Boiler efficiency can be overwritten if known. The programme will use this new value in all calculations.

translations.defaultText: By increasing the feedtank temperature will result in reducing Oxygen scavenging chemicals. The new temperature will also be used to calculate the amount of direct steam injection required to achieve the proposed temperature.
translations.translationText: By increasing the feedtank temperature will result in reducing Oxygen scavenging chemicals. The new temperature will also be used to calculate the amount of direct steam injection required to achieve the proposed temperature.

translations.defaultText: Compares the current cost of steam per year with the potential cost of steam based on the solutions selected. The cost of steam is based on the cost of fuel, water, water treatment chemicals, effluent, and carbon taxes.
translations.translationText: Compares the current cost of steam per year with the potential cost of steam based on the solutions selected. The cost of steam is based on the cost of fuel, water, water treatment chemicals, effluent, and carbon taxes.

translations.defaultText: Comparison graph of the Benchmark and Potential costs per yesr
translations.translationText: Comparison graph of the Benchmark and Potential costs per yesr

translations.defaultText: Cost of steam is based on fuel & associated carbon taxes, water, water chemicals and boiler house effluent.
translations.translationText: Cost of steam is based on fuel & associated carbon taxes, water, water chemicals and boiler house effluent.

translations.defaultText: Cost of water treatment chemicals / unit of boiler water being treated. For example ¬£0.15 / m3 boiler water. This includes O2 scavenging chemicals. If costs are unknown, or included in the cost of water, this will be shown as zero in the results.
translations.translationText: Cost of water treatment chemicals / unit of boiler water being treated. For example ¬£0.15 / m3 boiler water. This includes O2 scavenging chemicals. If costs are unknown, or included in the cost of water, this will be shown as zero in the results.

translations.defaultText: Cost of water treatment chemicals only. This does not include service agreements or maintenance costs.
translations.translationText: Cost of water treatment chemicals only. This does not include service agreements or maintenance costs.

translations.defaultText: Defined as: (Total energy of steam leaving boiler ‚Äì Total energy of the feedwater entering the boiler) √∑ Energy in the fuel supplied, in percentage terms.
translations.translationText: Defined as: (Total energy of steam leaving boiler ‚Äì Total energy of the feedwater entering the boiler) √∑ Energy in the fuel supplied, in percentage terms.

translations.defaultText: e.g. Cost of steam / tonne based on fuel, carbon taxes, water, water treatment chemicals and boiler house effluent
translations.translationText: e.g. Cost of steam / tonne based on fuel, carbon taxes, water, water treatment chemicals and boiler house effluent

translations.defaultText: Each bar in the bar chart shows the potential boiler house savings by each project in isolation to each other. This allows the user to prioritise which projects are worth considering to increase boiler house efficiency.
translations.translationText: Each bar in the bar chart shows the potential boiler house savings by each project in isolation to each other. This allows the user to prioritise which projects are worth considering to increase boiler house efficiency.

translations.defaultText: Effluent generated from the water treatment process, boiler blowdown, and any cooling water injected in to the blowdown vessel.
translations.translationText: Effluent generated from the water treatment process, boiler blowdown, and any cooling water injected in to the blowdown vessel.

translations.defaultText: Effluent produced through water rejection, flushing, or regeneration.
translations.translationText: Effluent produced through water rejection, flushing, or regeneration.

translations.defaultText: Effluent reduced in condensate return and subsequent reduction in water treatment effluent resulting in treating replacement boiler house water.
translations.translationText: Effluent reduced in condensate return and subsequent reduction in water treatment effluent resulting in treating replacement boiler house water.

translations.defaultText: Effluent resulting from water blowndown, cooling water (if present) on the blowdown vessel and water treatment effluent resulting from increased boiler house water consumption.
translations.translationText: Effluent resulting from water blowndown, cooling water (if present) on the blowdown vessel and water treatment effluent resulting from increased boiler house water consumption.

translations.defaultText: Either enter condensate return as a % of boiler feedwater, or alternatively see Condensate Return below.
translations.translationText: Either enter condensate return as a % of boiler feedwater, or alternatively see Condensate Return below.

translations.defaultText: Enter actual volume of additional condensate returned to the boiler house.
translations.translationText: Enter actual volume of additional condensate returned to the boiler house.

translations.defaultText: Equivalent boiler house water and water treatment chemicals saved.
translations.translationText: Equivalent boiler house water and water treatment chemicals saved.

translations.defaultText: Equivalent costs of boiler house water & chemicals that need to replace water blown down.
translations.translationText: Equivalent costs of boiler house water & chemicals that need to replace water blown down.

translations.defaultText: Equivalent fuel energy and CO2 emissions.
translations.translationText: Equivalent fuel energy and CO2 emissions.

translations.defaultText: Equivalent fuel energy required to heat makeup water to replace water blowndown.
translations.translationText: Equivalent fuel energy required to heat makeup water to replace water blowndown.

translations.defaultText: Equivalent fuel energy saved and subsequent reduction in CO2 emissions contained in condensate returned.
translations.translationText: Equivalent fuel energy saved and subsequent reduction in CO2 emissions contained in condensate returned.

translations.defaultText: Flash steam recovered from blowdown and returned to feedtank.
translations.translationText: Flash steam recovered from blowdown and returned to feedtank.

translations.defaultText: Fuel Units/year calculations are based on calorific value of fuel selected.
translations.translationText: Fuel Units/year calculations are based on calorific value of fuel selected.

translations.defaultText: Fuel, water and boiler house effluent savings from condensate return are not included, as they have been covered in the cost of steam generation.
translations.translationText: Fuel, water and boiler house effluent savings from condensate return are not included, as they have been covered in the cost of steam generation.

translations.defaultText: Gives the total potential savings including the water effluent reduced in the plant by increasing condensate return. Although this is not part of steam generation savings, it is a real saving by returning more condensate.
translations.translationText: Gives the total potential savings including the water effluent reduced in the plant by increasing condensate return. Although this is not part of steam generation savings, it is a real saving by returning more condensate.

translations.defaultText: Graph of the breakdown of the proposed cost savings
translations.translationText: Graph of the breakdown of the proposed cost savings

translations.defaultText: If a standard fuel is used, the calorific value and CO2 emissions / unit of fuel will be automatically populated from look-up tables.
translations.translationText: If a standard fuel is used, the calorific value and CO2 emissions / unit of fuel will be automatically populated from look-up tables.

translations.defaultText: If blowdown vessel selected and the check box ‚ÄúIs cooling water used‚Äù is ticked, it will impact on boiler house water consumption and effluent.
translations.translationText: If blowdown vessel selected and the check box ‚ÄúIs cooling water used‚Äù is ticked, it will impact on boiler house water consumption and effluent.

translations.defaultText: If boiler efficiency value is inputted, (or boiler efficiency is calculated from available inputs), then ticking the economiser present box will have no impact on the calculations.
translations.translationText: If boiler efficiency value is inputted, (or boiler efficiency is calculated from available inputs), then ticking the economiser present box will have no impact on the calculations.

translations.defaultText: If broken out from fuel bill, the fuel bill must be adjusted to prevent double counting.
translations.translationText: If broken out from fuel bill, the fuel bill must be adjusted to prevent double counting.

translations.defaultText: If carbon tax is part of the fuel bill, it can either be broken out to allow the cost of CO2 emissions to be calculated, or can be left as zero.
translations.translationText: If carbon tax is part of the fuel bill, it can either be broken out to allow the cost of CO2 emissions to be calculated, or can be left as zero.

translations.defaultText: If DSI is used, % condensate return cannot be calculated using temperature ratios of the feedtank, make-up water and condensate (see below).
translations.translationText: If DSI is used, % condensate return cannot be calculated using temperature ratios of the feedtank, make-up water and condensate (see below).

translations.defaultText: If not enough information is available, or DSI is used, or additional chemicals are added to the feedtank, % condensate return will have to be manually entered.
translations.translationText: If not enough information is available, or DSI is used, or additional chemicals are added to the feedtank, % condensate return will have to be manually entered.

translations.defaultText: If selected, this will increase the default value for boiler efficiency by approximately 4% dependent on the fuel selected. (See boiler efficiency above).
translations.translationText: If selected, this will increase the default value for boiler efficiency by approximately 4% dependent on the fuel selected. (See boiler efficiency above).

translations.defaultText: If the current boiler does not have an economiser installed and the check box is ticked, an additional 4% will be added to the boiler efficiency.
translations.translationText: If the current boiler does not have an economiser installed and the check box is ticked, an additional 4% will be added to the boiler efficiency.

translations.defaultText: If the fuel is not recognised then these values will require manual inputs.
translations.translationText: If the fuel is not recognised then these values will require manual inputs.

translations.defaultText: If this check box is ticked an alternative method of calculating % condensate return is used.
translations.translationText: If this check box is ticked an alternative method of calculating % condensate return is used.

translations.defaultText: If ticked, it will calculate the amount of Direct Steam Injection entering the feedtank.
translations.translationText: If ticked, it will calculate the amount of Direct Steam Injection entering the feedtank.

translations.defaultText: If unknown, the programme will attempt to calculate % condensate return based on either TDS or temperature ratios for make-up water, condensate returned, and boiler feedwater.
translations.translationText: If unknown, the programme will attempt to calculate % condensate return based on either TDS or temperature ratios for make-up water, condensate returned, and boiler feedwater.

translations.defaultText: If unknown, the programme will attempt to calculate the value. If this is not possible a default value will be used, based on fuel used, shown below:
translations.translationText: If unknown, the programme will attempt to calculate the value. If this is not possible a default value will be used, based on fuel used, shown below:

translations.defaultText: Is all water entering the Boiler House as part of the Steam Generation process meassured?
translations.translationText: Is all water entering the Boiler House as part of the Steam Generation process meassured?

translations.defaultText: It is assumed that the feedtank temperature equals the feedwater temperature entering the boiler (or boiler economiser if present). If additional heat recovery is used such as a FREME, this will result in an overestimation in fuel used (if calculated). It will also result in a too high a boiler efficiency value, if calculated.
translations.translationText: It is assumed that the feedtank temperature equals the feedwater temperature entering the boiler (or boiler economiser if present). If additional heat recovery is used such as a FREME, this will result in an overestimation in fuel used (if calculated). It will also result in a too high a boiler efficiency value, if calculated.

translations.defaultText: Maximum allowable boiler TDS level recommended by the boiler manufacturer.
translations.translationText: Maximum allowable boiler TDS level recommended by the boiler manufacturer.

translations.defaultText: NB: Total boiler house effluent value will be less than the sum of the water treatment effluent & blowdown effluent values. This is because the blowdown effluent also includes additional water treatment effluent in the makeup water required to replace the blowdown water.
translations.translationText: NB: Total boiler house effluent value will be less than the sum of the water treatment effluent & blowdown effluent values. This is because the blowdown effluent also includes additional water treatment effluent in the makeup water required to replace the blowdown water.

translations.defaultText: Overall steam generation efficiency shows the energy in kWh to produce 1 tonne of steam.
translations.translationText: Overall steam generation efficiency shows the energy in kWh to produce 1 tonne of steam.

translations.defaultText: % of water entering the water treatment plant lost due to flushing / regeneration, or rejection.
translations.translationText: % of water entering the water treatment plant lost due to flushing / regeneration, or rejection.

translations.defaultText: Percentage of condensate return compared to quantity of feedwater entering boiler.
translations.translationText: Percentage of condensate return compared to quantity of feedwater entering boiler.

translations.defaultText: Potential boiler house savings available based on  water, chemicals, fuel, CO2 emissions and water effluent reduced, resulting from the proposals selected.
translations.translationText: Potential boiler house savings available based on  water, chemicals, fuel, CO2 emissions and water effluent reduced, resulting from the proposals selected.

translations.defaultText: Potential reduction in boiler blowdown effluent due to subsequent lower feedwater TDS values.
translations.translationText: Potential reduction in boiler blowdown effluent due to subsequent lower feedwater TDS values.

translations.defaultText: Quantity & cost of effluent produced from water treatment and boiler blowdown.
translations.translationText: Quantity & cost of effluent produced from water treatment and boiler blowdown.

translations.defaultText: Quantity and costs of fuel entering the boilers
translations.translationText: Quantity and costs of fuel entering the boilers

translations.defaultText: Quantity & costs of water entering the boiler house. Cost of chemicals do not include service agreements or maintenance costs. If chemical costs are included in the water costs, then chemical costs will equal zero in outputs.
translations.translationText: Quantity & costs of water entering the boiler house. Cost of chemicals do not include service agreements or maintenance costs. If chemical costs are included in the water costs, then chemical costs will equal zero in outputs.

translations.defaultText: Quantity of boiler house water saved entering water treatment plant and subsequent water treatment chemicals.
translations.translationText: Quantity of boiler house water saved entering water treatment plant and subsequent water treatment chemicals.

translations.defaultText: Quantity of CO2 emitted resulting from quantity and type of fuel used in the boiler. Cost of CO2 emissions will only be displayed if cost of emissions have been specified.
translations.translationText: Quantity of CO2 emitted resulting from quantity and type of fuel used in the boiler. Cost of CO2 emissions will only be displayed if cost of emissions have been specified.

translations.defaultText: Quantity of steam (in Direct Steam Injection) used to maintain the feedtank or pressurised deaerator at the desired temperature or pressure respectively. Where DSI or a pressurised deaerator already exists, any reduction in steam injection load resulting from solutions offered should be reflected in the total steam generation rate. For simplicity the programme doesn‚Äôt reflect this value, however all energy savings from the solutions offered have been taken in to account.
translations.translationText: Quantity of steam (in Direct Steam Injection) used to maintain the feedtank or pressurised deaerator at the desired temperature or pressure respectively. Where DSI or a pressurised deaerator already exists, any reduction in steam injection load resulting from solutions offered should be reflected in the total steam generation rate. For simplicity the programme doesn‚Äôt reflect this value, however all energy savings from the solutions offered have been taken in to account.

translations.defaultText: Quantity of water entering the boiler(s) from the feedtank / pressurised deaerator.
translations.translationText: Quantity of water entering the boiler(s) from the feedtank / pressurised deaerator.

translations.defaultText: Recovers energy from remaining blowdown water leaving the flash vessel.
translations.translationText: Recovers energy from remaining blowdown water leaving the flash vessel.

translations.defaultText: Reduction in boiler blowdown effluent due to subsequent lower feedwater TDS values.
translations.translationText: Reduction in boiler blowdown effluent due to subsequent lower feedwater TDS values.

translations.defaultText: Reduction in water treatment effluent as a consequence of less boilerhouse water used.
translations.translationText: Reduction in water treatment effluent as a consequence of less boilerhouse water used.

translations.defaultText: Resulting additional CO2 emissions from additional fuel used.
translations.translationText: Resulting additional CO2 emissions from additional fuel used.

translations.defaultText: TDS of water before entering feedtank or pressurised deaerator.
translations.translationText: TDS of water before entering feedtank or pressurised deaerator.

translations.defaultText: Temperature of blowdown water exiting the heat exchanger to drain. A default value of 35¬∞C is recommended, however it can be altered. This must be at least 10¬∞C above makeup water temperature.
translations.translationText: Temperature of blowdown water exiting the heat exchanger to drain. A default value of 35¬∞C is recommended, however it can be altered. This must be at least 10¬∞C above makeup water temperature.

translations.defaultText: Temperature of makeup water entering the feedtank or pressurised deaerator.
translations.translationText: Temperature of makeup water entering the feedtank or pressurised deaerator.

translations.defaultText: The bar charts show the savings for each project selected and takes into account their influence on each other. For example increasing condensate return will have an impact on feedtank temperature reducing chemical savings made from DSI. It will also reduce TDS in the feedtank, again reducing blowdown and potential savings in heat recovery.
translations.translationText: The bar charts show the savings for each project selected and takes into account their influence on each other. For example increasing condensate return will have an impact on feedtank temperature reducing chemical savings made from DSI. It will also reduce TDS in the feedtank, again reducing blowdown and potential savings in heat recovery.

translations.defaultText: The cost of steam is also shown / kWh, which is the cost for steam to produce 1 kWh of energy.
translations.translationText: The cost of steam is also shown / kWh, which is the cost for steam to produce 1 kWh of energy.

translations.defaultText: The proposed situation is based on the addition of Reverse Osmosis, which typically has a water rejection rate of 30%. A TDS default value for water leaving the RO plant is taken as 15ppm when calculating reduced TDS blowdown.
translations.translationText: The proposed situation is based on the addition of Reverse Osmosis, which typically has a water rejection rate of 30%. A TDS default value for water leaving the RO plant is taken as 15ppm when calculating reduced TDS blowdown.

translations.defaultText: The steam pressure feeding the DSI is required to calculate the amount of steam required to achieve the new proposed feedtank temperature.
translations.translationText: The steam pressure feeding the DSI is required to calculate the amount of steam required to achieve the new proposed feedtank temperature.

translations.defaultText: This is used to calculate any chemical savings from increasing feedwater temperature using direct steam injection.
translations.translationText: This is used to calculate any chemical savings from increasing feedwater temperature using direct steam injection.

translations.defaultText: Total savings in condensate return in terms of:
translations.translationText: Total savings in condensate return in terms of:

translations.defaultText: Using the bar chart opposite, select which projects have the greatest potential by ticking the check boxes under ‚ÄúAdd Features‚Äù. As the options are added the programme calculates the potential saving, but now takes in to account the impact each project selected has on each other.
translations.translationText: Using the bar chart opposite, select which projects have the greatest potential by ticking the check boxes under ‚ÄúAdd Features‚Äù. As the options are added the programme calculates the potential saving, but now takes in to account the impact each project selected has on each other.

translations.defaultText: Water treatment chemicals added to the feedtank can alter the TDS / conductivity of the feedwater. We use this TDS value to calculate % condensate return.
translations.translationText: Water treatment chemicals added to the feedtank can alter the TDS / conductivity of the feedwater. We use this TDS value to calculate % condensate return.
